attributes.name: RecordArray
attributes.description:
A record array is an array that contains records of a certain type (or modelName).
The record array materializes records as needed when they are retrieved for the first
time. You should not create record arrays yourself. Instead, an instance of
`RecordArray` or its subclasses will be returned by your application's store
in response to queries.

This class should not be imported and instantiated by consuming applications.

methods.name: update
save

properties.description:
The flag to signal a `RecordArray` is currently loading data.
Example
```javascript
let people = store.peekAll('person');
people.isUpdating; // false
people.update();
people.isUpdating; // true
```
properties.name: isUpdating

properties.description: The modelClass represented by this record array.
properties.name: type

properties.description: The store that created this record array.
properties.name: store
